intro: Palaquium sorsogonense, commonly known as the Sorsogon Province native palm, is a small evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its slender trunk and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
